data.title: Good visit
data.text: Portions are small but the food is great.  The guacamole no matter hiw you get it is amazing.  The side salads are even great

data.title: Good food but pricey
data.text: I've been to this restaurant a couple times with friends, we've mutually agreed that the food is very good but a bit expensive. They do a nice job recreating new spins on traditional Central American dishes. Staff is always friendly and helpful. The bar and bathroom always looks clean. I would recommend this place for meeting up with friends on going on a date. Again, a bit expensive for what you're getting, but worth a try.

data.title: Nice alternative for more upscale Mexican fare
data.text: This is a nice restaurant in downtown Akron.  Parking is a bit challenging (as with most downtown eateries).  A bit pricy but nice for a change.

data.title: Unique downtown restaurant
data.text:
My son and daughter-in-law took me here for dinner.  It definitely is not your typical mexican food, but much classier.  The guacamole is unlike any other and super delicious.  
Great atmosphere and friendly attentive staff.  Definitely worth a visit if you like Mexican food.

data.title: Not your typical Mexican faire
data.text: Neuvo has clean flavors and classy upgrades to some delicious Mexican classics.  Their tequila flights are wonderfully worth trying - and very price conscious too!  Enjoy the many different types and flavors paired with amazing drinks in a very young, exciting atmosphere.

data.title: Best Menu in Akron
data.text: We sat downstairs in one of the booths on a Thursday night. The reservation was for 4, and they accommodated us to a table of 6 immediately.  Our service was excellent, food was amazing (I got the Costilla/Short Ribs), and the atmosphere is just as good.  Like I said, best menu in Akron.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I stopped here for lunch today and was very please with the place. The staff was friendly and attentive. I had the Carnitas and must say it was muy rico but for me the pork was just a tad on the dry side. The black beans a Spanish brown rice that come with it were very good but a little flavor is needed in the rice. Over all I'm very satisfied with this place and would recommend it to all.

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text: Ive been there many times, always happy with the food. Try eating upstairs on the patio. Great view.

data.title: So much better than expected
data.text:
We received a gift card for Christmas and kept putting off going to the "Mexican place".
We did no research before hand and we're just blown away. Great location downtown with a roof top patio, lively bar area and nicely designed dining areas. The menu was unique and not your typical meals. We started with the Haberno Jelly Guacamole with dark blue or black chips. Best we've ever had. We paired it with the Margarita flight. Interesting flavors and plenty to was down our app. The Jalapeño one was fun but, oh so hot. We tried the Manzana Quesadilla which was quite tasty and had a little kick. The Carnitas was a large amount of deliciously tender, nicely seasoned pork. We both subbed the Spoon Bread which was amazing. Our server was Kaley. She was friendly and patient, answering all our questions and making recommendations. Our bill for all that food and tequila, which was more than we could eat and drink, was $49 before tax and tip.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: We sat at the terrace, food was very good, service was on time. Very well located in Downtown Akron. Loved the plantains!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Staff and food was excellent ! The margaritas are to die for! I would come back over and over . Recommend stopping in if you are in town

data.title: Amazing cuisine and cocktails
data.text: Enjoyed a very interesting and delicious Mexican dinner.  This is definitely NOT a TexMex restaurant.  The dishes we ordered seemed more like authentic Mexican cuisine.  The Margarita selection was extensive and the drinks were very well made with fresh ingredients.

data.title: Small, busy bar and excellent ecclectic mexican dishes
data.text: A group of coworkers went around 630 and had a 45 minute wait (which we spent lounging in the bar area which had very reasonably priced drinks).  The wait was well worth it.  We were seated in the adjoining dining area with a fairly large group (9-10 people).  I can't remember the name but try the side of traditional fungus based dish (sounds gross, tastes great) that looks more like a well seasoned and blackened potato pancake - it was great just can't remember the dish's name.  I and several others enjoyed the braised pork which was very well prepared.  Try a flight of margaritas: for <$10 with a variety of flavors (cucumber and mango, etc.) and house-made rim salts (think bacon salt, mango salt, even a spicy salt).

data.title: Drinks and Appetizers
data.text: Very good food and drinks, but small portions considering the cost. Server was very fun. Nice atmosphere, but noisy.

data.title: Relaxing afternoon
data.text:
Food was good
Atmosphere was pleasant
Not much view but we enjoyed afternoon of appetizers and Great Drinks🎉

data.title: Not your typical Mexican joint
data.text: Unique in every way. From the quality of the food, to the choices of tequila - this is our go to place when we want Mexican food. Fresh and interesting flavors never disappoint. The atmosphere is casual yet sophisticated - and the roof top terrace is the best way to enjoy a margarita on a summer day or night.

data.title: Classics & new flavors w/ great service
data.text:
Nuevo is centrally located in downtown Akron, close to Lock 3 + 4 and the ballpark.  There is a cool patio, set above the street, but it's quite small so it fills up quickly.  Inside, our server was very helpful in explaining the menu and making a few recommendations.... such as the habanero jelly for the guacamole.  According to our server, everything was made fresh daily.

The guacamole was very bland, however, I loved it with the homemade chips & the habanero jelly (though it gave it an odd, non-guac flavor).  The jelly was surprisingly not that hot (as our server promised it wouldn't be too spicy).  Some of the menu is traditional Latin fare, but there is also a section with twists on the classic.  I chose a pork entree & it was great.  The service was great too, but this isn't the cheapest mexican eatery.  For the price, I was totally underwhelmed with the guac.

data.title: High-end and fresh Mexican food.
data.text: We had heard about Nuevo for a while, and it didn't disappoint.  The food is gourmet Mexican, very fresh and very flavorful.  The flavors pop, and both of our meals had a spicy kick but not too much.  I had the carnitas, very tender braised pork.  My husband had the maple pork sausage with sunny side egg and spicy cabbage slaw.  He enjoyed his dish but liked my carnitas better.  Both meals came with rice and beans for side dishes. We plan to go back to try other meals.  We started with the freshly-made guacamole and blue corn ships, which were also very good.  Our server, Corey, was great!  He knew the menu and preparation of all of the dishes.  With my dairy problem, I get tired of servers having to constantly check with the kitchen.  Corey knew what I could and couldn't eat and only had to check on one item to be certain.  He has an excellent beer knowledge, too, and let us take our time and ask many questions about drinks and dinner.  We will tell others about Nuevo and definitely be back!

data.title: Modern Spin as Advertised
data.text:
As advertised, Nuevo puts a modern spin on classic Mexican dishes.   Located in downtown Akron, this renovated historical site has an inside bar, rooftop bar and several dining spaces.  Appetizers and meals seemed reasonably priced.  Drink prices varied based on what was ordered, and, their drink specialties are tequila and margaritas.  

Our party of six shared the salsa and guacamole appetizers.  Each item came with 3 unique guacamoles and salsas which were absolutely delicious.  Our party had the chicken quesadillas, flank steak, skilpack vegetarian burrito, scallops, and trout..  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Each item had an unusual twist on the flavors holding true to the restaurant’s mission.  Portions were large enough to share since everyone took home about half of their entree.

This is a local restaurant which adds to an exciting restored vibe in downtown Akron. Nuevo is a busy place, so reservations are a must.  Valet parking is available or park on the street or in the public parking deck behind the restaurant. The public parking deck is free after 9pm. The restaurant is close to the channel lock and baseball stadium.

data.title: Not your average Mexican restaurant
data.text: They were very gracious when we were late because of a downpour.  My husband had the Lomo, a pork dish and I had the Aerolina, a chicken dish.  Both were deeply delicious and flavorful.  Each offering on the menu was tempting so it was hard to choose and we will just have to back and try another.
